Reviews.Title: “Celebrating birthday with family from and to the island of beautiful puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: Diane A
Reviews.Content: In spite of gusting winds and rain showers, the staff at the hotel from Sabrina, Miguel and all other staff could not have been more accommodating to us within a group of 30. The chef, Manny, served me a red snapper fish that was so beautifully shaped, it practically sand happy birthday to me. A group as big as ours is usually complicated to best serve everyone, yet everyone at this hotel and Cafe la Plage did an amazing job ensuring we had a memorable dinner party. If you have patience and believe things will work out, they usually do :)

Reviews.Title: “Place is nice....rooms not so much”
Reviews.Author: Nav87
Reviews.Content: If I was to write a review on bar and access to the beach, I would give this place 4 to 5 stars (or circles in this case). Room has a LOT to be desired. First, the bathroom. How about a counter to put your stuff on? If you carry more than a toothbrush arrangements need to be made. Water pressure is always weak. Water temp (i.e. hot) is not always available. Small water heater must be shared with entire building. Time your showers accordingly. Speaking of a place to put your stuff....plan on living out of your suitcase. They offer no furniture and thus no drawers. Atmosphere here is great during the day and night at and around the bar. However, you do not need to be a resident to enjoy the fun here. Find a room where you will be more comfortable. This is not the place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brenda A
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple stayed in this lovely little hotel for a week. After reading reviews I was some what hesitant but that all disappeared upon checking in. Taxi driver knew exactly where the hotel was, staff were wonderful, friendly and went out our their way to help us. We arrived before our rooms were ready so they kept our bags while we stopped in the bar for a drink, Jennifer the day bartender greeted us with a smile and for the remainder of our stay always said good morning even remembered our names. You couldn't ask for a more perfect spot, right on the beach and beautifully decorated, plenty of chairs, couches and little nooks and crannies to sit and kick back, a little piece of paradise. Rooms were more than adequate, always clean. The no hot water comments are unfounded as the water was so hot you had to be careful when you got in the shower. Breakfast in the mornings was lovely lots of choices and beautifully presented the staff were always attentive making sure they didn't run out of anything. The hotel manager was present everyday and was genuinely concerned that our stay was everything that we hoped it would be. This is a small hotel with a down to earth friendly atmosphere so if your looking for all the bells and whistles a resort would be better, if your looking for a relaxing laid back vacation this is perfect. Nice restaurant always fresh flowers on the tables, good food, and attentive staff. We had a wonderful experience and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Foxy8112
Reviews.Content: I went to Puerto Rico as a last minute trip/ vacation with my sister! AWESOME HOTEL!!!!!!!!!! I would def stay there if I ever go to PR again and I will def recommend it to my friends! I love the fact that this hotel located RIGHT ON A BEACH!!!! You step out of your room and you are on a beach. I don't know who had a problems with the hot water......OUT hot water was just fine......sometimes tooooooo hot! I can't say anything bad about this hotel.....NOTHING! I love it!

Reviews.Title: “We aren't too picky so we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jessncase
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I wanted a girls trip on a budget,(we just graduated college) so I found Casa de la Playa aka Beach House Hotel. We loved this place.It COULD be a lot better than what it is,but overall it is budget friendly and in a nice area with plenty of restaurants.We did not stay in our room a lot,but when we were in it...it was decent.It is nowhere near an Embassy Suites but it's definitely nice and clean enough to lay your bags and sleep.For example,the room floors are tile but they were sandy and dirty our entire stay (and at check in) but I just kept my flip flops on the entire time otherwise my feet would have been black on the bottom.I felt safe here although if you arrive at night it can look sketchy.It is a very tiny hotel between 2 large condos and we had somewhat a difficult time finding it too.Luckily,our taxicab driver knew exactly where it was.So before you go,just remember it is ALMOST exactly across from the only Howard Johnson Hotel.So if you see Ho Jo,you are almost in front of it.If you stay here,walk down the street and pass Pizza City (roughly 3 blocks) and eat in the plaza where the Burger King is.There is an ABSOLUTELY amazing SMALL and chic Puerto Rican restaurant named Mi Casita.It is soooooo goood.It gets crowded during dinner so get there early.We ate there 3 out of the 5 days in Puerto Rico!I would recommend this place ONLY IF YOU ARE NOT EXTREMELY PICKY!Oh yea,and the night guy is so very very very very rude.Don't even deal with him,he will urk the living daylights out of you.However,Jennifer is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Convenient, and Moderately Priced”
Reviews.Author: LakeHMM
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels in Puerto Rico. It's one of the cheaper hotels in the area. The exterior is really pretty. It's right on the beach and there are nice cabana things for guests to hang out at. There is wifi in the rooms and on the beach area. There's also a bar on the beach. It's conveniently located, close to various hotels, beaches, restaurants, convenience stores, and rental car companies. The rooms aren't too nice, though, and they don't have fridges in them. The complimentary breakfast isn't worth going to. Parking is available. The hotel can be identified from Ave. Isla Verde by a sign reading "cafe la plage".

Reviews.Title: “An eye opener”
Reviews.Author: tonyhalik
Reviews.Content: This is the cheapest hotel in the area, it is located directly on the beach. Thatâ€™s as far as it goes for this supposed three star hotel rated by Expedia. The taxi driver couldnâ€™t find the place as it displays a different name over the building so he dropped us off leaving us to find it. I would say that this should be advertised as a restaurant / bar with rooms upstairs. I think this place experiences many people leaving after one night judging by the phone call I could hear from the receptionist and a travel agent. Unfortunately for us, we booked over a weekend where the bar area was used for a wedding, hence loud music till 0230hrs. Also unfortunately for us, it was spring break, and the lower prices attracted young American students being introduced to alcohol for the first time. With this in mind, there was no surprise when leaving the room to go to breakfast, in the hall way was a dunk American guy lying in his own dribble. It was difficult to identify who was staff, as they wore no uniforms. Plus there was no housekeeping or secure safe for valuables. The beach towels were probably better used as a hand towel or a flannel. This is the worst hotel bar/dinner I have ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “100% Charming”
Reviews.Author: Shrink2
Reviews.Content: A tiny place, maybe the only small place left on a gorgeous beach otherwise filled with hi-rise apartments and megahotels. Very friendly staff, simple but pleasant rooms, very good restaurant in hotel and several more really good places within walking distance. Great beach-front, lovely spot to hang out. Kiteboards, parasail, jetski all available from kiosks on beach. During our stay there was a party for a local family. Lots of music and fun, but by bedtime it was nice and quiet. Had minor problem with room which staff quickly corrected. I am puzzled by some of the negative comments, and can only imagine that others were hoping for a high-glitz experience. This place is a real slice of old-style PR hospitality-- our stay was really wonderful, and we'll look forward to our next visit. The sign is indeed very small, but GPS found the address-- it's directly opposite Ruben Cafe, which is very well lit up! No elevator, but you don't need very much baggage to enjoy this lovely spot.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Jcowboys1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend here and it was great. Staff was very friendly especially Jeremy, beach was beautiful, would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “The good and mostly the bad of the Beach House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WpgFoodie101
Reviews.Content: It took me about 30 minutes to find this hotel because the address on google maps was wrong and then the hotel had absolutly no signage...I needed to ask at the front desk if I was in the right place. I had called for directions and the person on the other end was quite dismissive. I ended up stopping at another hotel to get directions. The staff offered to help me with my bags which was really nice becaue my room was on the second floor and the only way up was via a very narrow staircase. When I got to the room, I was a little bit surprised at how small it was. I knew I was going to a boutique hotel, but I thought there would be a little bit more room. With the bed and the side tables in the room, I barely had enough room to open my suitcase. The bathroom was basically a closet. When I went to have a shower, I didn't have enough room to wash my hair, and then the shower went from scalding hot to ice cold in the matter of seconds. Also, my room was located right above the water pump, so anytime that someone else in the hotel would use the water, the pump would run. When ordering drinks be sure to specify that you want Don Q rum if you'd like to use the coupons they give you...otherwise they will use something else. Breakfast is a little scant, but was enough for me. The beach was absolutly beautiful and they had some really nice outdoor furniture for the beach. Location is excellent. This hotel was fine for what I used it for... a place to sleep before my plane in the morning. Not sure if I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Weapons and Drugs”
Reviews.Author: Lipslipslips
Reviews.Content: We left after one night because the rooms were dirty and I found a full clip of 9mm Glock bullets and an empty cocaine bag in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Scary!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie E
Reviews.Content: We had a syringe under our bed, sand in our bed, no hot water. Had to wear ear plugs to sleep because the music was so loud. Our "great view" was of a storage room. Don't let the pictures fool you!! I will admit that the beach was nice.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Becky B
Reviews.Content: For it's price, you won't find a better place to stay on Isla Verde. It's on the beach and has tons of character, a restaurant/ bar, rooms with balconies overlooking the ocean and is affordable. However it's not excellent, and if you can afford to pay more you should consider staying elsewhere. I stayed here in Jan. of '10 and loved it despite the fact it was in a state of disrepair- nothing essential was broken but the bars under the railings were rusting and falling off, the windows were all rusted shut and there were signs of water damage everywhere. I stayed here again in Jan. '12 and it's gone even more downhill since my last visit. There was no hot water for the third night of my stay, the waitstaff were rude and inattentive (unlike in '10 when they were wonderful!) and the restaurant was inexplicably closed without warning on the last night of our stay. Again, I highly recommend this place if it's in your price range but it's a bit of a gamble.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, best price in the area though”
Reviews.Author: OBXchillin
Reviews.Content: Room had everything a basic $160 oceanfront room would have to offer. My hot water took a while (just like a lot of places in the area) I was oceanfront on the top floor but no OF views except a very slim peak of the beach from the side winow. Atleast it was cool that they had a second floor patio with deck furniture. I liked the complimentary beach furniture just like the other more expensive in the area offer. No pads on the beach loungers like the Ritz though so may want to bring a towel to put on top of it. I did not like the bar with unfriendly bartenders attached to the hotel, although they apparently have no relation to each other. You could go across street to BK or the nice taco city place to get some medalla. There is also a Pizza place across from that which has some good NY style Pizza

Reviews.Title: “NOISE ALL NIGHT-NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: KiterYO
Reviews.Content: We had a layover and decided to hit the beach for some kiteboarding. Was initially delighted in finding this inexpensive option with great location that appeared to be a stylish boutique hotel. It is not. It is run down..as other reviews say-dirty, stained and rusty. Looks great in the bar area at night. That about it. We had No hot water and the water trickled out. The noise from the bar was loud and what was worst was when peole left it they all congregated outside the rooms and made so much noise until 4am. You can also hear the busy street traffic. Service at the bar was also dreadful. After waiting one hour for a burger and sandwich I went back to the bar to enquire as to it's whereabouts only to be told that he forgot what I wanted and hadn't put the order into the kitchen. One redeeming factor is the nice reception staff. If you don't plan to sleep, eat or have a shower...stay here!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: djtkrx
Reviews.Content: I was on business from not pleasure the rooms were not fancy I mean you get what you pay for its a good place if you wanna get away. The employees were friendly I stayed in room 4

Reviews.Title: “our thanksgiving getaway....”
Reviews.Author: Micky T
Reviews.Content: staff was generous and friendly, it made me feel very comfortable just like home. we love the beach view from the back with the tropical setting. its very romantic and relaxing. although i have to admit that the property does need some touch-up wouldnt hurt it. next time i go, i would hope to see the property's new renovation look....

Reviews.Title: “Since the Eightys”
Reviews.Author: gary s
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on many occasions. Been coming since Hurricane Hugo. Love it there. But if your looking for luxury move on. Looking for an affordable easy access Beach and Casino nightlife this is it. Been through many staffs there. This one is very friendly even though i speak very little spanish always got what i needed. Restaurant very good. Sunday is day to hit the Beach. Lots of locals. Friday and Sat nights music if you cant handle noise dont stay. But if you like this sort of thing GREAT.................. Thanks to the staff Especially Kenny I'll be BACK........................

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Juan278
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Beach House for three days and was the best desicion I make... People this is not a fancy hotel (if you want to stay in a fancy one go to the ritz and pay 400 per night) this is an european style hotel... Its very cozy and charming hotel. I went to pr to be all day on the beach not in my room. They have a great beach area with sofas and beds right in the beach... they also have a great food menu... the beach wasnt crowded like other hotels in isla verde... the room was clean... Marcos help me a lot with everything. He help me with the luggage also with my car reservation and the tours. They also have massages at the beach... I love this place and im going back next year for sure....

Reviews.Title: “pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jramirezj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach and it has a very nice, hip lounge area (kind of Niki beach look". The rooms are clean, not very big but nicely decorated. if you are loooking for a "hotel chain" experience look somewhere else. the restaurant is AMAZING. try the ceviche

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B
Reviews.Content: The first thing I would say is not to get fooled by the pictures of this hotel...the pictures are staged perfectly but when you get there, there is a tiny lounge area, the rooms are small with dirty floors, no natural light. If you're looking for some quiet and relaxing place THIS IS NOT THE PLACE. They have loud music playing until about 2am, you might as well be sleeping at the lounge area, that's how loud it was. I stayed there with my 2 girlfriends, we are young and like to party, but it was even annoying to us. Some of the staff was very nice or really rude. We asked for 3 towels for the beach and they gave us only 2, when we asked for a 3rd, one of the owners/manager said right in front of us "no, they should be happy with that!!" We encounter a tropical storm while staying there, they slid a paper under the door with instructions, letting us know that water and candles were going to be given to the guests in case of a power outage....the lights did go out but no candles or water were ever distributed. Overall, pay the extra money for a better hotel, would not recommend to my enemy!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to swim and relax!”
Reviews.Author: Irene46772
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a week's stay at The Beach House and it was absolutely lovely! We weren't sure what to expect from the mixed reviews, but we were very pleasantly surprised! A short ride from the airport and car rental place, registration was fast and efficient - Marcos was absolutely wonderful and helped us in every way possible, as did the rest of the staff there. Our room was very small, but extremely clean and fresh smelling, well stocked with hangars (no dresser), clean sheets, freshly painted walls, nice flat screen TV, tiled bathroom with shampoo, conditioner, towels, lotion, etc., great water pressure in the shower, unbelievably great AC, quiet. Marcos helped us up the stairs with our luggage, we enjoyed great coconut mojitos on the beach, dined in the outdoor restaurant (you must try the churrasco, pulled pork sandwiches and mango salad - yummy!) A bit pricey, but well worth it. Days were spent on the beach lounging on the cabana beds, swimming in the ocean, watching the kite surfers, going to old San Juan, zip lining in the El Yunque Rainforest, and kayaking in Fajardo at the bioluminescent bay! We were always supplied with fresh towels for the beach and shower and they also replaced a light bulb in the bathroom. Staff goes out of their way to help you - really and truly! I can't say enough about this place except that we are definitely coming back as soon as we can! Oh, and the sunsets are spectacular... Very safe area, Isla Verde, big police presence, even on horseback on the beach. The Beach House is not a place to go to if you need a lot of amenities - but if you want to have a great time, it's the place to go! It was noisy one night when they were having a party in the restaurant downstairs, but it didn't bother us. The walls are very solid and I slept with no problem at all. I believe that some of the people who posted negative comments here were expecting a resort atmosphere at a budget price and were disappointed. Why would one need an elevator in a hotel that is two stories high and has only 17 rooms? Anyway, if you don't need a pool, room service or a fitness center or spa, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for us, first choice if we visit again!”
Reviews.Author: NayNay_Carlos
Reviews.Content: The Beach House was comfortable and accommodating. Everything mentioned on the website was there, wi-fi, restaurant, nice bar, hotel amenties, great customer service, good room service, air conditioning, nice lotion and shampoo, beach chairs, beach towels. The rooms were small but fine if you are out and about in PR. The shower water was not very hot, but again this place was idea for us in every other way! We walked out of our room along the wooden boardwalk a few steps and on the beach. The beach was very clean. It was a cozy and beautiful little place amongst the high rises and our new favorite place on all of Isla Verde!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return...”
Reviews.Author: plobban
Reviews.Content: The Beach House hotel was exactly what we were looking for if you want to enjoy the beach, food, and nightlife of Puerto Rico. The room was small but clean and very kitch, in a cute way. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They provided driving directions to all our activities and responded to all our questions/concerns quickly. We had an issue with the water pressure in our room and it was fixed the next day. The location is worth the lack of the amenties from the larger resort or hotel chain. There was plenty of local restaurants within walking distance that were delicious and reasonably priced. The bar service at the hotel was friendly and convenient as well asa the restaurant (pricey but delicious). We enjoyed every single day of our stay and regret having to leave without having to try kite boarding (did not have enough time). Kenneth (the bartender) showed me how to make a passion fruit mohjito and pointed us in the right direction for the local nightlife. Marcus at the front desk was always helpful and friendly and never got impatient with our many many requests and questions. We would definitely come back again. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible !!!!”
Reviews.Author: livegood77
Reviews.Content: This place is dirty, noisy and the staff has a pretty bad customer service. The beach front is the only nice thing about this "Motel". Do yourself a favor and do not stay here, I read the comments that some people left for this place, I am amaze that some people can actually talk good about this place. For and extra $30. got to holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “EEWWWW.....Stay AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: bobbypink05
Reviews.Content: booked through hotels.com for July 2-6. I read the mixed reviews, but still decided to take the chance. (on a budget) what a huge mistake! after entering our room we called hotels.com to cancel our reservations! NOTHING like the pics. it's 100x worse. my bf and I felt so dirty in the room. it's very tiny, no dressers, nasty bathrooms, and cracks in door. no elevator and no one to help carry your luggage up stairs. the hotel is on beach, but that's the only plus. the price is NOT worth it at all. oh, and we had to pay $150 penalty fee to cancel (1 night charge plus tax?). we literally opened the door to our room and called hotels.com it was so bad we didn't care, we just wanted out.... so we ended up at the San Juan water and beach club hotel. (perfect there FYI)

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room, but Beautiful Beach Setting”
Reviews.Author: cmlmls
Reviews.Content: The Beach House was a good place for a low budget place to stay. It is right on the beach with a bar on the beach and a inside bar for when it rains. The rooms are basic - a bed, a small tv, and a bathroom. The humidity was so intense that the floors were wet when we returned to our place after lunch. The room would be good for young singles, but is not a romantic resort get-away. We originally were put in a room above the inside bar and the bass from the music was so loud we could barely hear each other. Then we were put in a room on the inside walk-way and the live music was so loud it was as if the singer was in our room. So if you plan on spending limited quiet time in your room and just want to be relaxing on the beach couches with a cold beverage in had, this place if for you. The price was right though compared to the other resorts in the area. There was free parking for hotel guests. You had to pay for all food, including breakfast. It was about a 15-20 minute drive into Old San Juan. It was right on the beach. There was no pool. I don't think this place being good for children.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing comeback to kitesurfing at Cafe La Plage PR”
Reviews.Author: christophe_martinpr
Reviews.Content: can't believe I am kitesurfing again! it's been 10 years without touching a kite; I had a lot of fun last sunday on the water!! Thanks to 15 knots kiteboarding school www.15knots.com and instructor Juan Carlos Morales for providing updated tips and equipment. The school location in Cafe La plage is just amazing. The set up including bar, cafe/restaurant, live DJ's, confortable beach to launch kites easily, convenient & free air compressor...definitely looking forward to keep kitesurfing there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and great bar on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: net_paloma
Reviews.Content: If you are a beach person, this is the place for you. The hotel itself is very nice, not so big and the room we stayed was quite small but overall it was comfortable and clean. They have plenty of couches, tables and Indonesian beds on the beach so you can really enjoy the weather while having fresh drinks and listening to the music from the bar. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: jatwood44
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent 4 days in Puerto Rico at the Beach House Hotel in Isla Verde, PR, and we were absolutely thrilled with the experience! The Beach House is a small, classic-style hotel with a great (low) number of rooms -- no overcrowding at all. It includes all the lovely touches that make Caribbean hotels special. Originally, our reason for choosing this hotel was its size -- to that was added flowers, arches over the doors, small but very comfortable rooms with amazing beds -- we slept like babies! The staff is friendly, quick, helpful in every way we asked them to be. The bar and restaurant are both outdoors on the beach, and the hotel has a great collection of overstuffed chairs and couches, lovely day beds with curtains, and a reasonable amount of Puerto Rican music -- not annoying, but rather it addced a nice beat to our stay. Surprisingly, this hotel had the only permanent seats on the beach -- otherwise, we had two miles of empty sand and a beautiful sea breeze. Finally, the bar and restaurant were cheerful and cozy; the entire hotel was cozy. One of the very few disappointments we faced is the strong undertow on the beach. I was caught quite quickly, and I had to call on two men running by, and my mom, to pull me out. No one was swimming, most of the time. We did see a kite-surfer giving lessons. What fun! A plus for us, but a minus for some, I'm sure, is the happy quiet atmosphere with no wild games or partying. If you are looking for spring break, don't look here. The hotel staff pointed us in the direction of a small diner, right across the street from the hotel, called Ruben's diner. I never found this on Yelp or any other restaurant search engine, but the food was tasty, the service very friendly, and the cafe con leche a truly decadent treat. We tried other small restaurants around, including another diner and a pizza place, but we just couldn't stay away from Ruben's. It is inexpensive, with a broad menu, a lovely dining-room/bar setup, and the most cheerful staff you could hope for. I will post photos as soon as possible. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know, with the possible exception of my younger adult, partying friends, and I will be back! Thanks, Beach House Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: jewhammer
Reviews.Content: PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE, My wife and I stayed last July for 4 nights and 5 days during our honeymoon. When we first arrived there was no parking, so we were told that it was safe to park our vehicle approximately 70 yards away with all of our luggage. Then, when we arrived we waited and waited for the F#%%# scum bag front desk staff to get off of his personal cell phone. When we finally got our room there was a "Mix up" about our duration at the hotel but we were assured that it would be taken care of in the morning. Finally we went down the dirty uncleaned stairs to the bar/ lounge area. We paid 20 dollars for a s#%% tasting beer & one mixed drink for my wife. They staff did not tell us that it was their national party month for their local beer Madaila who had the most loud, obnoxious, and crappy mother #%%# in attendance. My wife and I had to cancel our dinner plans on the beach twice because things were getting out of hand. The bar and beach were constantly crowded. Last but not least when we finally were able to check out they said we owed another 1,250 dollars because they f%#%# up our reservations. I IMPLORE ALL OF YOU FOR THE GRACE OF GOD DO NOT STAY AT THIS HELL WHOLE. The only good thing about this experience is my wife and I know now we can get through anything together. Thanks Sam S.

Reviews.Title: “i love this place. one of my favorite places to stay in PR”
Reviews.Author: melikeypuntacana
Reviews.Content: I love this cozy hotel. After a crazy night at the clubs I knew I would be able to come back to my room and sleep if I wanted to the entire next day because there isnt' any noise to wake me. All the employees are very accomodating and very nice. I love the breakfast and the food at dinner time is wonderful as well. This hotel is also very convenient when wanting to lay on the beach. They provide you with towels and a lawn chair which is set up for you by an employee at the hotel!!!! I love love love this hotel and would stay there from now on every time i go to PR. That's at least twice a year!!!! I definitely recommend it to all my friends and family!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay in this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ailuy
Reviews.Content: â€¦even if you are 20 years old and like to stay up drinking all night do not stay in this hotel. Everything mentioned in previous reviews is true. Deafening noise all night and all day, uncomfortable room, everything in various state of disrepair, rooms with wooden shutters covered over with sheet of plastic in place of windows, neighbors who are 20 years old and like to stay up drinking, banging doors, yelling, vomiting and just generally having a good time right outside your door â€˜till 3..4..5 am. So, anyway even if all of the above are things you can live with, the main reason you should not stay in this hotel (please do not stay in this hotel) is they donâ€™t want you there. I donâ€™t know if restaurant/bar is their main business or not, but clearly no one in that hotel is interested at all in accommodating guests. Itâ€™s almost as if they do all they can to make you uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Like Heaven”
Reviews.Author: mecarlitosway
Reviews.Content: After all that snow here in the city NYC, it make sense to run away and keep you life in a place you can call heaven. The place is juts amazing with those frontal beach views. And those bedding just for you to chillout with white-Linen an cotton. I felt as if I was in the clouds next to the deep Caribbean Ocean. The crazy part is that I was!! My friends and I drank and party at the same spot â€œWho in the right mind will moveâ€� people are great, staff, food and the BAR! Mamma Miaâ€¦ here I go again.. How can you resist thisâ€¦ Oh well I will see my self here very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach and Kitesurfing!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquedavid
Reviews.Content: I came here to get away from this awful cold in Canada. Upon my arrival I was drawn to how many people were on the beach kite surfing. The hotel offers classes to learn how to experience this thrill for yourself, it was a great experience with good food and a relaxing setting. I hope to come back in the future with friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay in Puerto Rico!!!”
Reviews.Author: nrg36
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice, relaxing vacation this is the place to go! My husband and I went for our anniversary and had the best time. They have beds on the beach and plenty of chaise lounges. The food and drinks were excellent and the staff was very friendly. Definitely a place to go with your spouse or friends, you're guaranteed to have a great time!!! We'r e already planning our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel on the Beach In San Juan”
Reviews.Author: tusenkatts
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel a year ago and have returned twice. It is small but on a lovely section of beach near the International Airport. Soaps, etc. in the bathroom are lovely and while the rooms are pretty basic, they are good value for the $$ in San Juan. The staff is very nice and accomodating. Drinks or dinner on the beach are a nice way to end your flight in. We use this hotel when we are planning on being there for one or two nights. Local party place on weekends. There is a fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Should have believed the other reviews...”
Reviews.Author: smithstrip
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a dissapointment! Pics and mix of good/bad reviews persuaded me to book this hotel, mistake. Although I did not see a single cockroach, I tried to switch hotels the very first night. The establishment is basically a lounge/bar/restaurant with a hotel as a side business. After being told there were absolutely no refunds (and not interested in losing $850), we switched to a room where you could not hear the hotel cleaning staff loudly gossiping in the supply room at dawn, only to find that the club music was played so loudly the room shook until at least midnight, later on the weekend nights when the dance club was open. The rooms were poorly insulated, we slept with ear plugs. The windows are shutters with plastic, no glass. The beds were neat, but the doors/curtains/chairs were filthy. Hand soap was not provided. And this was just the inside...outside the lawn/beach furniture was disgusting, falling apart and very dirty. Service was hit and miss, with the desk staff also being bar keep and dj, we waited 15 minutes for someone to check us in. Looks nice at night when it is dark and the candles are lit with waves crashing, but spend the extra $50 a night and stay at a real hotel, one that looks good in the day too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Megan039
Reviews.Content: My mother, college aged daughter and I travelled to Puerto Rico for a very short beach visit and found the Beach House Hotel through an internet search. We were looking for an affordable hotel right on the beach. The hotel room was very basic but clean. The beach front was fantastic. We loved having the bar out on the beach and the multiple seating areas on the beach front. Great hotel if you don't plan to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Place sucks”
Reviews.Author: Freddy0727
Reviews.Content: The room was horrible. No telephone to call for room service. The room was tiny and the decor felt more like a cheap $25 hotel. Could not connect to internet because the signal was low. I left after one night and went to the Sheraton. This hotel should not put itself at a level of a sheraton since it charge me $160 a night and the sheraton cost me $180 a night. I strongly do not recomend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “CRAP”
Reviews.Author: RMUSTPR
Reviews.Content: Those who wrote a goodreview for this place must be related to the manager, this place is CRAP the manager iss an a__ and the staff are lazy because they all hate the manager. This is the worst place i have ever stayed.Over priced with bad service.Go anywhere else but here. IF YOU THINK YOU SHOULD STAY HERE AND SEE FOR YOUR SELF YOU ARE A FOOL. Stay some place else and take a look at this place first before you waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Worse than Motel 6 WITH COCKROACHES”
Reviews.Author: Andrade2010
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews on here before booking my trip and still decided to stay here for 3 nights to give it a chance. I should have listened to the reviews! Upon checking in, you are required to pay for entire stay upfront. I shoul dhave at least looked at the rooms before hand! The first night was HORRIBLE! We had specifically asked for the quitest room since we had read reviews about the restuarant being loud. It was SO noisy!!! and the beds were the worst I ahve ever slept in. We were seriously sleeping on springs and the full sized bed didnt make it any better. After getting about 3 hours total of sleep that night, my husband ended up sleeping on the little couch, as that was more comfortable than the bed. I had complained to the hotel that very next morning and they moved us into a different room and had given us a foam mat to go oh the bed. I have to admit, the foam mat wasnt the best but made a world of a difference from the night before. I was feeling better until that night when we had gotten back from dinner, to open our room and see a cockroach running on the ground... ARE YOU SERIOUS!? I again went and complained and told them that I wanted to cancel the rest of our reservations and we would leave immediately. They would not refund our money and said that they do not do that after we have already checked in and without 48 hours notice. We were forced to stay there another night. After staying there 3 nights, we came home with all sorts of bug bites all over our bodies and still have them!!! The website is a LIE! It looks nice, but it is just like the horror stories you hear about the dating websites, once you actually meet the person, they look nothing like their glamour shot pictures! I will NEVER go back here and would NEVER recommend this hotel! We spent $600 at this hotel and expected it to be a good place to stay... we were SO wrong, and I am SO dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN PUERTO RICO”
Reviews.Author: celina18
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Puerto Rico for getaway weekends with friends for years and love it! The reason I didn't go more often is that hotels in Puerto Rico are very EXPENSIVE! When I found the Beach House Hotel last year I was pleased to finally find a simple hotel room where Im not being ripped off to stay on the beach. I saw the complaints here and find it outrageous that ppl will complain over a $100 room, on the beach and expect 5 star amenities-- (although they also have very nice soaps) I love the authentic feel of this property, the hospitality of the staff, and the pristine beach. The rooms are not huge but clean and comfortable enough. For $100 Ill take a smaller room over charm anytime! For those looking for an authentic, beach hotel - this it - if not go pay $300 at the fancy ones down the block! Now I go to PR more often thanks to this find..and its 5 minutes from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “moderately priced, relaxing, great drinks, thanks for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaqua
Reviews.Content: Came with a friend in September, our first time to Puerto Rico, and we were just looking to relax and decompress. This hotel was great, friendly staff, great drinks, comfortable and JUST what we were looking for! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL FROM HELL”
Reviews.Author: tbaer57
Reviews.Content: This was my very first time coming to Puerto Rico and also my first vacation with my Boyfriend. When I was looking for a place to stay, that was quiet and on the beach and a moderate price range, I kept coming back to this place several times, do to the appeal of the pictures on your wed-site. Wanted this to be a romantic vacation. Upon arrival, we were sadly disappointed!! The building is extremely run-down and in need of SERIOUS UPDATES! The room we were given , let's just say , "I'VE SEEN LARGER WALK-IN CLOSETS!! " I went right to the front desk and said that your ad on the web-site is a total misrepresentation, that the room we were given was a disgrace and that i wanted another room. They did, I'll give them that much. The room they gave us wasn't that much better . An old wall ac that didn't work, still in the wall. The furniture was another joke, I've seen better things i could decorate with@ the local "FAMILY DOLLAR" store. The bathroom wasn't any better. Poor lighting, wall shelf almost ready to fall off, and a small corner shower. My boy-friend is 6ft. and barely fit. Even the beach area was very run down. This place needs "Extreme Make-over" Beach addition! This to me is a place for people to go drinking on the beach and then go pass out in your room, not some place for a romantic couples get-away!! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “ANTVILLE HORROR”
Reviews.Author: kluscious185
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an awesome website presentation of their hotel. DON'T BELIEVE WHAT YOU SEE! It was a horrible hotel! We had just returned from a cruise and we were very tired. We reserved the hotel prior from cheaptickets.com. BIG MISTAKE...... Their rooms are musty, no natural air, the windows were covered with a plastic, we woke up to ants in our bed AND all over our accessories. They have a restaraunt with a club and the noise and music was horrible. We couldnt sleep until 4am. That's how long it took everyone to leave the darn bar. Parking was horrible, there was NO guest parking. Since the hotel was on the beach anyone could drive to the hotel, park and go into the beach. NO guest parking, customer service is horrible. BEWARE please don't make the same mistake of taking chances. You will regrett it. AND by the way we had a 3 day stay reserved and cancelled the following day. They did not want to reimburse me the remaining 2 days despite me complaining about their conditions. Their response was "I am sorry you feel that way" BECAREFUL!!! Run away fast..... don't waste your money!!!! You will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in greater San Juan area”
Reviews.Author: Petronela44
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay away from big resorts full of other tourists and like the beach, this is it! Probably the smallest boutique hotel in the area with only 17 rooms, this place seems to be sought out by the locals and couples (for the romantic feel). The rooms don't have the greatest view and are simple, but they are clean, air-conditioned and quiet (but who comes to PR to stay in their hotel room...?). The staff is beyond friendly and because of the size of the place, you get to know them very soon and vice versa. The Beach House does not have a pool or jacuzzi or a gym, but it is right on the finest beach in Isla Verde with canopied beds partially shaded by palm trees and plenty of chez-lounges so why would anyone need a pool? The bar/restaurant called La Plage is outside, between the canopy beds and your room. It is loungey, spacious and the food is delicious. The prices are cheaper than most other hotels in the area and they will bring your drinks to the beach! It is walking distance from the large hotels in the area, so if you want to visit their bars and restaurants it is easy, with a quick escape back to your sanctuary. If you're on a budget, right across the street is Los Pinos, a local 24 hour place with super cheap and yummy food and drinks. I can't believe how lucky we got to find this place, but I wanna go back every year!!!! I cannot say a single bad thing about this place. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tobago01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Beach House for my birtday for 4 days, 3 nights and I can say the view was breathtaking. The staff was very nice and helpdul. The room itself had no ammentities. No Phone, no clock, no radio, just a basic room with a bed and a shower. I loved that the hotel had a night spot underneath..on the beach. Nice music and great food on the beach. Couldn't ask for anything more for the type of stay I had in mind. The hotel was a block or two from El San Juan casino and Brava Night club. There was food, a liquor store and Walgreens nearby. We caught the bus to and from Old San Juan and took the ferry to the Bacardi Rum factory. We stayed up at night and just laid on the beach in a cabana plus the bartenders showed us a wonderful time. I would definitaly recommend this hotel and thats based mostly on the beach view alone...great experience, I would give them a 8!

Reviews.Title: “I stay 3 night whit my girlfriend ans we...”
Reviews.Author: juan3411
Reviews.Content: I stay 3 night whit my girlfriend ans we have a wonderful time the bar in the beach was fantastic is a great place for couple...I'm coming back next year for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “May Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sardyllei
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It sat right on the beach and the scenery was great. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The food served here was pretty good and the mojitos were excellent. I would definately stay at this hotel again. My only advice is due to the smallness of this hotel, a lot of cab drivers did not know where it was so make sure you specify The Beach House La Plage and they will know what you are talking about. : )

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster on a nice beach”
Reviews.Author: SallyWillickers
Reviews.Content: We felt like fools when we showed up at the Beach House Hotel for the first half of the vacation. We had booked the hotel via Expedia and the pictures/info on Expedia, and the hotels website, were very exciting. What a complete misrepresentation!!!!! This isn't a hotel...it's barely a motel and a dirty one at that. The rooms were the size of a box with no dressers and a tiny closet. The bathroom was the nicest part of the room and it was also tiny. The grounds themselves are terrible and our "continental breakfast" consisted of toast and cereal. The location is also very inconvenient if you want to go explore Old Sasn Juan and pay a $40 cab ride round trip each day. :( More importantly, we payed a mid-level hotel price to stay in this dump! Outrageous! The only nice htings I can say about this hotel are 1) the staff is actually very friendly, 2) the Margraitas are frankly amazing, and 3) the beach beds and other beach amenities are wonderful and the only selling point for this location. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!! There are nicer hotels closer to Old San Juan on Condado Beach!

Reviews.Title: “amazing beach and staff with tragic rooms and major misrepresentation on website”
Reviews.Author: Travis D
Reviews.Content: I want to begin by thanking the staff at the Beach House so much for their efforts in helping us during our brief visit. We were initially booked for a 4-night trip, but ended up leaving after the first night for so many unfortunate reasons. The staff, from check-in to dealing with our room change requests and complaints upon early check-out were understanding, compassionate and very apologetic. It was almost as if they were accustomed to these complaints and had a protocol with which to handle the situation. Clearly we are not the first to find that the Beach House is NOTHING like what you see on their website. However, if you're looking for an amazing beach and don't care about where you sleep, you'll love the Beach House. The large day beds on the beach are magnificent and almost make you forget about the room from which you came. The open bar on the ocean is a nice retreat and though we did not eat at the hotel, I heard from almost every other guest how delicious their offerings were. All staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with questions. The issue with the Beach House is that the hotel itself, in terms of accommodations, is extremely outdated. Upon check-in, we were taken to a room on the 2nd level that almost had no room for our luggage, let alone the two of us. It was extremely damp, dreary, claustrophobic and ultimately, unclean. The type of room where you know they do everything they can to make it look nice, but everything is simply so old that you can't attain perfection. Requesting to be moved, the manager was very kind and upgraded us to a separate building after showing me several rooms (a small studio if you will at the front of the property, but directly in the parking lot/entrance) because of the length of our stay. It was a nicer, more open space, but still severely lacking in so many areas. The wireless internet of the hotel did not reach our room, though we were only 10 steps from the front desk. The floors were filthy, the toilet seat almost completely unattached from the porcelain bowl, the shower dial required a compass to find the .5-degree zone at which you could attain hot water. To add insult to injury, there was drilling, hammering, and sawing on the roof of this unit almost all day - perhaps an attempt at much needed renovations, which they should focus on the interior of the rooms themselves. The bed was moderate at best, with old linens and well worn pillows.. Upon waking up after our first night at the Beach House, we had no electricity in our unit which was the final straw. For the price ($135/night) none of this was a major disappointment given the extravagant beach and friendliness of the staff. But for four nights (during which I wanted to spend our days relaxing after great nights of sleep) we just couldn't handle the hassle and decided to leave for a hotel that may be more expensive, but at the very least, is comfortable and clean. They were very kind and credited us for the remaining three nights without a penalty because of all the problems that we had encountered and the fact that the hotel's website is NOT representative whatsoever of what you get at the Beach House.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it appears to be.....”
Reviews.Author: swimgirlAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The photos brought us in..was also recommended by a colleague....however, upon entering our room, it was below a super 6 standard. Had to keep the a/c very cold in order to avoid moisture throughout the room..bar invites outsiders for loud music and lots of alcohol..into very early hours of the morning...however, the staff could not be more welcoming!!! If you like funky and camping out,,this might be for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: hoshi_samurai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beach House over night, and it just happened to have been during a fashion event held on that evening. The manager invited me to attend, which may have something to do with the fact that my room was right behind the bar. Regardless, I found the place to be pleasant enough for one evening, I'm not sure if I would make a point of staying there over for more then a few nights. I wouldn't say this is a family type of hotel, but I found the staff to be very pleasant and I enjoyed my dinner very much while dinning right on the beach. One of the issues I had was the lack of phones in the room, however when I requested a wake-up call, one of the staff members knocked on my door and made sure I was up for my appointment. I think if you want to hang lose and party this is the place for you. Yolanda

Reviews.Title: “STAY FAR AWAY!!! KEEP RUNNING!!! DON'T BE FOOLED!!”
Reviews.Author: brklyntraveler
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but, I had to after this absolutely horrid experience. The air conditioner was so loud and must have been from 1970. in order to even change the temp/ turn it on or off you had to stand on the very corner of the bed and hope to not fall. The pillows had some blood or gross bodily fluid on them and it was awful. i feel so dumb for not leaving as soon as we saw that. the bathroom door had visible hand prints on it--maybe from the same night as the bloody pillows. the view from the window was some sort of metal cover on the window. remote for the tv was broken and the woman at the desk was so upset when i interrupted her celphone conversation to ask for a new one. she didn;t even put it down. she just held it away from her face. when i brought the pillows down she gave me such an attitude and asked me (with an attitude) if i needed new ones. no apology, nothing. we just decided to sleep on the towels and noth even use pillows. i feel so dumb for not running away. oh yeah, you won't get lonely beacuse you have the ants in the room to keep you company. this place looks very nice from the outside but don't be deceived. for the money they charge you think they would be much nicer. run as fast as you can and don't look back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming, though noisy at night; small food list, but perfectly cooked, service extremely nice,& efficient”
Reviews.Author: BibiQuebec
Reviews.Content: Expect many surprises! By far the best beach side we found. Comfortable beds and rooms, well decorated rooms, though some rooms are small. Clean-hot showers, lovely excellent quality( well above average) soaps, shampoos etc. Food menu was the average tapas-burger, but everything we had was certainly made above the average restaurant expectation. The personnel is friendly, extremely efficient and eager to help and suggest diverses activities, places to go etc, and visibly love their job there. MAJOR TURN OFF: quite noisy week-end nights, as it becomes "the place to be" ; the AC, very noisy as well covers most of the noise and make sleep possible. Avoid beach/bar side rooms during WE.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you're not right next to the hotel bar!”
Reviews.Author: naniboujou
Reviews.Content: Our room was right behind the bar. The A/C drowned out most of the bar noise, but not the noise all through the night from people walking around the building to take their break...right under our window. The hotel restaurant is a glorified burger bar; very limited selection. The room was extremely tiny. There was a shelf mounted at head-height outside the bathroom - very dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: BeachCombers12
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay at The Beach House as a stopover from Vieques, before flying out of San Juan the next day. Looking forward to a chic and relaxing last night of our trip. Booked and confirmed reservation through Orbitz. On check-in, I was told The Beach House could not 'process' payment from Orbitz, and I would need to pay for the room. I presented my reservation confirmation as proof of payment, but it was not acceptable. I was told to take the issue up with Orbitz, upon return home. It seemed like a scam, but my options were: 1) Walk away from my confirmed reservation, find a new hotel, and sacrifice my payment to Orbitz, or 2) Pay again for the room and recover my payment from Orbitz later. Guess what? I paid twice for the room. The Beach House processed my Orbitz payment AND my personal payment. Now I am 2000 miles away, and The Beach House is giving me the telephone run-around. Orbitz did not assist me in any way, which was extremely disappointing. I won't even go into a review of our dank room, but I do want to get the only satisfaction I can from my visit to The Beach House by warning other travelers of the scam they pulled on me.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The BEST !!!”
Reviews.Author: cyclingdave67
Reviews.Content: It's a home away from home, never a dull moment, the smell of the ocean in the morning while having breakfast is second to none !! The owners will make feel like you are part of the family. It's a sin if you book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Beach House”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCity__g
Reviews.Content: The Beach House is the perfect couple's getaway - a beautiful setting right on one of the top beaches on the island, an elegant bar steps away from your room, and great parties on site a few nights per week. The restaurant/lounge on the beach is super romantic, especially when the sun goes down - the perfect torch-lit getaway where you can sip some champagne and much on some tasty tapas. Take a clue from the hotel's title: it's a Beach House - I think some of the negative reviews on this site might be from people expecting a resort. This place is very casual, which is what makes it so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere lots of personality!!”
Reviews.Author: gperezarce
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in a great location and at the same time feel the privacy of your own beachâ€¦this is the place for you. I travel to Puerto Rico every month I always bring my clients to this unique Hotel; it is a combination of seclusion and urban living. The staff is very professional and polite; they just know when you need them. The ambience during the day is serene and relaxed a perfect place to close deals; at night it becomes a perfect lounge with beautiful people, superb food, and awesome drinksâ€¦again in your private beach. If you need some more action just enter â€œLa Folieâ€� translates â€œmadnessâ€� or â€œlocuraâ€� a neoclassic French bar to end the night dancing in a melting pot of cultures. Finally few steps away you will find a comfortable and clean room to rest for the next business day!! I strongly recommend trying this hotel, it is a different experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Great value, unbeatable location, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: Kobe2009
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Beach House this past weekend and were so happy with our choice. To be clear..the rooms are okay, not terrible and not spectacular but if you are going to Puerto Rico for the room...don't go to Puerto Rico. The room was small but it had everything we needed, TV, AC, a comfortable bed, a shower and it was clean. The MAJOR positives about this Hotel are the Staff and the Beach location..The Beach House ladies were extremely friendly and accomadating. [And ridiculosly pretty, my fiance and I joked that they only employee Miss Puerto Rico Runner-ups :-) ] Seriously though, they made our stay very comfortable. THE BEST thing about this Hotel is the Beach access, it's right at your doorstep, leave your room and in 30 seconds you are laying on a Bed!!..Right On The Beach!!..having a cocktail...In Paradise. The hotel is going through some much needed renovations and should only improve. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to enjoy PR for a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mrfresco
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel, great parties, food and awesome service. Best red snapper i've ever had! It isn't a family hotel but if you're young and looking for fun this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay - Walk A Past The Bar & There Is The Beach”
Reviews.Author: Lunakitty
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Juan. My mom & I wanted to stay someplace that was close to the beach & not too expensive. The hotel is located on the beach. The beach is nice & private with only condos next door. Since you are on the beach, of course there will be sand but that is a small thing to deal with when you can walk outside your room, take a walk past the restaurant/bar & be able to sit on the beach watching the waives. The room was a little smaller then I wanted but it is worth it. We arrived at 8:30pm on a Saturday, I talked to the staff that checked us in & she was able to make some calls so we could take a private tour of Old San Juan the next day. Anytime we had questions, the staff helped. I would defiantly recommend staying here if you are wanting to be close to the beach that is not crowded & close to a lot of things on to do!!

Reviews.Title: “where is my bathing suit top?”
Reviews.Author: gbagirlie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very cute and the beach even better. the night we got there after traveling all day, we could barely get checked in due to the fact that there was some sort of hip hop party that lasted for 2 days! the next day, my boyfriend and i had plans to go to viequez when all of a sudden, my bathing suit top was missing. it was not where i had left it and when i asked them to search for it (b/c maybe housekeeping accidently scooped it up) they pretty much treated me like an idiot. 2 hours later, we were on the beach and i just happened to go back to the room when i noticed that OUR ROOM WAS FLOODED! The toilet had become detached from the wall. HOW does this happen? They did offer a 20% discount (which after 3 months) we still have not seen.

Reviews.Title: “It was not what we expected! not what we saw in the pictures...”
Reviews.Author: travieza
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our first year wedding anniversary, we decided to book a hotel online like always. While searching this hotel i fell in love with the pictures. My husband was in Army Training so I decided to surprised him, yea right i was the one SURPRISED!! When we did the check in and went to the JUNIOR SWEET, I almost died.There were lot of things missing from the pictures we saw. The bed did not have the thing that was on top, there was no fridge, no oven, a tiny air that is was so hot that was not cooling the room. We fell in a MOTEL... One of the doors did not have look, we were kind of scared. In the morning there is no BREAKFAST.... when we ask they told us you can go out, buy your food and eat it here... very disappointing. Well let see some good things that we can say.. the location is great, lot of stores, restaurants, tourists, places to go, the beach great. In the night the hotel was a good place to hang with your partner, it was romantic, it had a nice view, nice mini bar and a least food...you also can go out and have a blast. At all... we think that the hotel has a lot of things that have to improve. DON'T FALL FOR THE PICTURES. But as always say... EL AMBIENTE DE DIVERSION LO CREAS TU, al fin de todo la pasamos de maravilla en el area.... BUT I WILL NOT GO BACK!! Aguadilla P.R. July 30 to August 1, 2009 LCB and JCG

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Go here if you don't mind sand on the floors, no hot water in the showers, no water pressure, and bedding that looks like it's circa 1975. In other words, go here if you're a college student. The beach access and on-site bar are nice. Also, I tried to use a AAA discount when booking and they quoted me a rate only to have me show up at the hotel and refuse to acknowledge my discount. I asked the manager to call me - she never did. The other girls behind the counter are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Check your door”
Reviews.Author: cjnorm
Reviews.Content: The rooms are just ok, but all of the staff makes up for that. The only problem was that the person on the night shift let himself into our room. He also did this to two others. The hotel did give us a 15% cut on the room. All in all for one night the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eclipse_grl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Beach House Hotel with my daughter and some friends..After reading the reveiws, I wasn't to sure what to expect. If your looking for a 4 star hotel, this is not a place to go..but If you want something less expensive..this is the place. The room was a nice size for four of us and I had no problem with the shower..the only thing about the room..no fridge..and the drinks at the hotel..very expensive and very little alcohol...so we just went and bought our own..alot cheaper. I would recommend going to Old San Juan..very, very nice..loved the shops and the old town sites. The cab ride from the hotel is around $20....one way..but it was worth it. If your looking to go out..we didnt find many places to go around the hotel and no entertainment during the week..just weekends. We ask the front desk guy to call us a cab...but the whole thing was shady..we got to the place where they told us to go and very scary..it looked like a wharehouse with graffati..we told cab driver to take us back...and all the cab drivers and some employee's there were very rude!!!!! There is a burger king and wendy's that was nice you could walk to.. I would go back there...had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “All about the beach..”
Reviews.Author: 12XU
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here over the New Years holiday, interested mostly in easy access to the beach and not spending tons of money. For what it is, a low key no-frills spot on the beach, it was pretty good for us. The beach set-up is very nice- 3 cabanas, lounge chairs, and a bar with super friendly service. As far as Caribbean beaches go, Isla Verde is not spectacular but it's as good as any near San Juan- nicer than the beach along Condado. It's a long sandy beach with quite a bit of kelp in parts- although the beachfront in front of the hotel was very clean and you could swim out a couple hundred yards easily. Our room was tiny, but the staff kept it clean and the DVD player and Ipod dock were nice touches.. and seriously there's no reason to spend extended time in the room since the cabanas outside were always available. The continental breakfast every day was surprisingly good. The restaurant is fine for dinner, nothing special. A warning, this is Puerto Rico so you may find walking in the area around the hotel a little seedy.. Condom World, tattoo shops, liquor stores etc.. but we walked around every night and never felt unsafe. The 15 minute walk up to check out the Ritz Carlton is probably worth it. In the other direction, toward San Juan there's a restaurant called Ceviche House which had a Peruvian-themed menu, great seafood and sangria and seemed popular with the locals. And Barrachina (sp?) bar about a quarter mile west of the hotel makes an amazing Pina Colada. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel that takes you into Old San Juan for $0.75, which is very convenient. Avoid during rush hour though!! All in all if you're just looking for a place to chill on the beach and nothing fancy, I'd recommend this place. If you're interested in more amenities (like say, a pool), and walking distance to OSJ, staying in Condado may be a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Is the Beach House for you?”
Reviews.Author: psudoo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and price, but the biggest reason we wanted to stay here was to verify all of the reviews that I had read. I had a feeling that many of them were written by â€œspoiledâ€� middle aged American women. Puerto Rico, first and foremost, is a Third world nation. They do not live by the same standards that most middle class Americans live by. So you should be prepared for showers that have little water pressure, and little to no hot water. If you spend any time exploring the island you will see that there are very few places that are â€œclean.â€� The Beach House I would say is about as good as you get without spending $400 or better per night on a room. The location is central to the airport and the ship yards and is the perfect place to start a car trip as the highways are 30 seconds from the parking lot. Some reviews complain about airport noise, but I guess I didnâ€™t notice as I live near Oâ€™Hare in Chicago, which is a million times worse. We stayed in room 18, the largest room directly over the Night Club. It was a delight to see how big this room was after reading all of the complaints of small rooms. I would say it was about 25x30 with two sitting areas, a small kitchen area with 2 refrigerators, and a large bathroom. Opposite the entry door was a door that walked out to a large private terrace with a table and chairs; where the staff even lit some candles at night for us. That terrace then steps down to another terrace that leads you to the bar area. I can concur that Chris was a hospitable bartender and was happy to take shots with us even though it was raining and very windy. Although I did not meet Sabrina, she was very helpful over the phone when I called to make reservations the week prior to our trip. As for the rest of the staff they were more than pleasant. I would imagine that it would take a terrible, evil and overly needy sort of person to say that the staff is Horrible. Again this is not the RITZ. The restaurant was good although pricey and could have used another page or two in the menu. But I noticed that everything in that area of PR was very over priced! The down side. There were spots of blood on the sheets. There was no hot water and no water pressure. From the street the place looks like a hostel. And the Music was VERY LOUD but the people were LOUDER!! The Dj did stop at exactly 2am. Because I had read so many reviews about the loud music I expected some noise but COME ON. For its location we were willing to overlook anything that most would complain about, it is one of the few places to stay directly on the beach, besides the El San Juan, which has a great pool and whirlpool that you can walk into from the beach. I also suggest walking to the bar at Hotel La Playa, they have an Amazing Hummus plate. So if you are looking for a place on a beautiful beach, donâ€™t require much assistance from staff, are not a neat freak, like to party with locals until 2am, and want to save some money, The Beach House is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: cruzinjc
Reviews.Content: 1) Housekeeping - After reading all the reviews, the first thing we did when we checked in was to check our sheets and sure enough there was hair on the comforter, flat sheet, fitted sheet, and pillow cases. My husband immediately took it all off and went to the front desk and asked for it to be taken careof. We happened to meet Pete while waiting for the front desk to address the issue and explained to him why we were waiting. Pete immediately went upstairs to change our sheets and he even mopped the floor, that looked like it hadn't been cleaned for days. We actually went to Walmart and bought a lightweight comforter and asked that they keep their comforter out of the room. Housekeeping leaves alot to be desired!!! 2) Rooms - Our room was small (no biggie)..no phone, no drawers, a small closet to hang stuff, no refrigerator. We ended up just living right out of our suitcase. Just an fyi if you are a heavy packer. 3) Staff - Pete (works the morning shift and is responsible for the beach area and breakfast)...made our stay worthwhile. He took care of all the guests, no matter what the request. We would go for walks every morning and upon our return Pete awaited us with water and had the beachchairs/umbrella all setup for us. He was amazing. He also provided a list of things for us to do and a list of great restaurants. Sabrina (runs the frontdesk and is one of the managers)...she was accommodating and pleasant to deal with. Our flight wasn't scheduled to depart until late afternoon, she allowed us to extend our stay at no charge so we had a place to wait without having to get stuck at the airport. Chris (ran the bar while we were there)...he was very kind and had great conversations with us. Also gave great suggestions on places to visit. 4) Restaurant - Only ate there once and it was good. However, to our surprise the menu had no Puerto Rican dishes available. We often ate out because of this and the restaurant doesn't open until after 5. It was closed on Monday and Tuesday. For lunch you also have to leave the hotel due to their hours. 5) Bar - Relaxing atmosphere during the day (very chic), however the rock music totally disrupted the atmosphere. When the carribbean or the jazz music was on, it was such a relaxing place to be. The bar was opened Wed - Sun from 12pm on. On Friday and Satuday the bar is open to everyone (guests and what seemed to be all the locals in san juan) and it doesn't close until after 1am and the music is LOUD!! On Sunday we figured we wouldn't have to deal with the massive crowds, we would just relax...NOT the case. There was something going on in the lounge and it was soooo LOUD! a little irritating at times. There is no schedule or information available that warns you...so be AWARE! The bar and restaurant were closed on both Monday and Tuesday (surprised) and so be ready to go out for food and drinks. 6) Room Service - not your typical because none of the rooms have phones. So you go downstairs to the frontdesk (a few feet from the bar/rest) and tell the attendant what you want and they bring it up to you. Hello, if you have to get up and get dressed, you might as well go to the back patio and eat! 7) Parking - The hotel provided parking. However be aware on weekends the place gets packed because of the bar and so if you go out make sure and return by 7ish because the parking gets filled and you will lose your spot. Ridiculous, I know but be warned! 8) Beach area - is absolutely beautiful and in my opinion probably the most enticing within miles. It is available to the locals as well which didn't seem to be a big deal. Everyone seemed to be having a good time. Overall, the stay was a pleasant one. The biggest frustration for us was housekeeping and the late hours at the bar. We probably wouldn't stay here again on our next few visits to San Juan. We actually visited the condo's to the right and left of the hotel and found that we could rent a place for about the same price and have an extra room and a kitchen. Not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable choice on the beach, although with its problems.”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn238
Reviews.Content: We are pretty low-key couple who didn't need a lot of frills, just a weekend getaway on the beach, so the Beach House Hotel was a good fit -- affordably priced, located near the airport (we had late arriving and early departing flights), and right on the beach. I must say, the location on the beach is really this hotel's best feature. The beds and cabanas outside on the beach are great, as well as beach-side service for drinks/food etc. Hanging out on the cabanas at night is definitely a lot of fun as well. The complimentary breakfast is extremely basic....mini-boxes of cereal, some sad pieces of fruit, and coffe/tea. Not great, but did the job. The restaurant on the beach is decent, and service was fine. The rooms definitely could use a lot of improvement. We spotted a few cockroaches and only had hot water once during our weekend stay. Apparently there were problems/construction at the hotel (or maybe the city too?) The decor makes it seem hip and trendy, but is really just covering up some levels of crustiness. Location was great. We were able to walk to other fancy hotels eat at their restaurants, go to the casinos, etc. Would probably not stay here next time, but would definitely stay at a neighboring hotel and enjoy the day relaxing on their chairs/lounges and eating at the bar. If you are considering this hotel, I think it'd suffice for a really short trip (no more than 3 nights.) Although the beach-side amenities are great, you can still access them even if you aren't staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: madmen
Reviews.Content: PLEASE don't stay here... The photos are totally misleading. We stayed for 9 days at this below-standard hotel and what they did not tell us was they are renovating.Literally,wheelbarrows full of rubble going through the middle of the restaurant/patio area! We are not fussy travelers but the rooms were what you would expect at a crappy motel off the highway. We were given a room facing the parking lot and I insisted on an ocean view which we got two days later.The bed was broken and leaning to one side.They fixed it with a cinderblock. And last,the only food was a very expensive restaurant.No options. The breakfast was bad coffee and old pastry and finally we were charged $7 for a bottle of warm water in our room! STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “May 25-29”
Reviews.Author: christofides
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I had a very pleasant experience overall. The hotel staff was very nice and the hotel itself is a very trendy spot. Though quite loud at night--we slept fine with the television or the ipod playing. The beach wasn't overcrowded and service for the beach chair towels was great. We tried the appetizer menu (at the bar--not the restaurant) and it was awesome. If you venture out, 'the taco stand' is a few blocks away and is a very popular spot for locals to grab beers and the food is good.. **If you are used to resort style traveling, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find and a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sandlubbers
Reviews.Content: March 20-21 & March 29: We found the Beach House Hotel to be a very pleasant surprise, in marked contrast to numerous negative reviews in Trip Advisor. Though our rooms were small, they were clean and comfortable, and despite forewarnings, turned out to be quiet for our two pre-cruise nights. The small, intimate hotel did have the distinct feel of a boutique hotel and had a unique ambiance. The biggest beef among reviewers seemed focused on poor staff service. Forewarned with this information, we went out of our way to test the staff on service at every opportunity. We found all we encountered to be very friendly and accommodative. We would particularly single out Sabrina at the front desk for her concern and responsiveness. Upon check-in we noted that the hotel provided i-pod dock in our room was lacking a power cord. Upon reporting this to Sabrina, she showed up in less than five minutes with a replacement. She was equally prompt in responding to our request for extra hangars for our closet. Other staff assistance was provided regarding rain forest cruise information and directions to other venues in the area. The front desk staff promptly summoned a taxi when requested. We enjoyed two great dinners at the hotel restaurant (Cafe LePlage) which was in the most romantic setting imaginable. We chose tables for both dinners that were actually on the sand beach behind the hotel. We enjoyed friendly out-door bar service prior to dinner. The hotel beach area was illuminated with torches. They have three Asian daybeds on the beach. Their sheer curtains billowed in the pleasant breeze off the sea and caught the reflective light from the torches. It was an absolutely gorgeous setting (click on â€œhotel photosâ€� at the Trip Advisor review page for the hotel). The food was excellent. Peter and Gretchen rendered excellent and attentive table service. On the Saturday night of our post-cruise stay at the hotel, we did experience the noise we came to expect from reading the reviews. However, we thought it worth it because the source of the noise was a traditional Brazilian wedding that took place at the hotel on the aforementioned beach. The festivities included about a 45 minute non-stop performance by a drum corps (apparently a Brazilian wedding custom), which we enjoyed very much. Our second dinner on the beach was actually within feet of the ceremony and subsequent "reception". We almost felt like wedding guests, though we abandoned the party early as it went on on until at least 3:00 am. To deal with the noise, we simply turned on our i-pod in our room to great effect in muffling the noise. We requested a late check-out on our departure date because of our late afternoon flight and were graciously accommodated. We spent some more time on the beach. Again, a request for beach towels was responded to promptly. The only inconvenience we experienced was a near complete water shutoff on our last morning at the hotel. Upon inquiring, we were told that the city was working on water supply lines and that the hotel had no control over it. Understood, but notice of such could and should have been provided as a courtesy to guests. Otherwise, we suspect that most of the problems experienced by others may have been attitude problems of their own rather than that of the staff. As for us, we wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return to Beach House. Tom & Barb R. (Chicago area)

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: AisleSeatPlease
