Reviews.Content: This place looks great online, but very different in reality. We arrived 10 minutes before check in time and our room was not ready. No problem, we grabbed a late lunch at the restaurant. Service there was incredibly slow (even though we were the only people in the restaurant) and our waitress was awkward. The food was good when it finally arrived. After lunch, our room was still not ready. We went shopping and returned later to a room that was definetly not worth the wait. Dirty walls with scuff marks, very dirty bedspreads with multiple stains, running toilet, tile floors that reminded me of 1970s linoleum that seemed dirty, windows with blinds that do not open so there really aren't any windows and it was very cavelike with one flurescent overhead light. The rooms were very small and sparsely furnished...not even a clock or phone, no artwork on the walls, just a mirror. We checked out immediately, ate the cost of one night stay and rebooked elsewhere. It's unfortunate, because the beach and location is beautiful. With minimal investment in decor and attention to good housekeeping, this could be a great place, but in it's present state, we found this highly undesirable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For What We Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: jefftego
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here and I think the negative reviews have more to do with the fact that this place may not be for everyone. But for the right people and for what we needed, it was perfect. We stayed here for 2 nights before our cruise out of San Juan and it was the perfect place to start our vacation, especially for the price and location. The hotel is right on the beach. It is also adjacent to lots of hotels/restaurants that share the beach and we had a few meals at the other hotels. However, the food, bar and service at The Beach House were excellent. The room was great as well. Not huge and more in line with European hotels -- smaller space, etc. But we weren't in our room other than to sleep. I can understand why this is not a great place for families with young kids, business travelers, or people looking for a more traditional hotel. But for young people, the young at heart and those looking for something out of the ordinary, this is a great place! The only negative is that on Friday and Saturday night they have parties with a DJ that go late into the night and you can hear it from the rooms. However, I am a heavy sleeper and my wife wears ear plugs. We had no issue with the noise at all. So for the right people, this is a great hotel and a great place to start a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not your big chain with all the extras but lovely”
Reviews.Author: 1nOnly-T
Reviews.Content: This small Euro-chic hotel is wonderful. They really put a lot into the details. The rooms are small but very well kept. Beautiful tile work in the bathroom and bed linens are coordinated but simplistic. The staff is very friendly and will do what they can to please. Victor and Sabrina were just a few that made us very comfortable and welcome. Very popular beach spot for the locals, with the beds and lounge areas itâ€™s no wonder why. Great food and bar service the entire stay. They even had wireless internet connection available at no cost. Truly enjoyed my visit and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Ballon811
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night and glad that is all it was. The room looked cute until you saw it with the light on. The linens were filthy. I am guessing dirty mop water but I was pregnant and tired so at that point I did not care. I slept with my clothes on. On the evening we stayed a couple there only for dinner had a rat fall off the roof of the resurant and die right on therir table. I was sitting at the bar waiting forever for a pop when the waitress came over to ask the manager what to do and her response was" what do they expect when they eay outside"? We went to bed right away and were checked out by 7:00. Gross, gross, gross. DO NBOT BOOK at stay here unless you want to pay $200 for a room that should be $20 in a flop house.

Reviews.Title: “Old, unkempt, and terribly overpriced.. think of it as a hostel”
Reviews.Author: ellebee08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2008. Tiny, cramped rooms with lumpy mattresses and filthly coverlets. Do NOT be fooled into thinking this is a boutique hotel! It hasn't been painted in many years and is showing it's age. We paid $185 and it was wayyyyy overpriced. In fact, I would have paid double to stay elsewhere. Very loud disco music and inept staff. Shower had two temperatures.... cold & scalding, and required a staff member literally in the shower to show how to use the old, loose plumbing fixtures with hot & cold mixed up. Do not waste your money--this is more of a hostel than a hotel. Yick!

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Echomaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true rip-off. I booked two rooms on Expedia for $160.00 a night, but ended up being charged $190.00 due to extra hotel surcharges. But even for $160 a night, this place is really overpriced. Although they have done decent job renovating, the rooms were quite small and the mattresses were shot. Worst of all, the hotel holds a "discotheque" every Friday and Saturday until the wee hours of the morning so that you should be prepared to go to bed to the beat of bad techno music. On the upside, the beach is pretty nice and right there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Petit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpmalet
Reviews.Content: I am from Europe and stayed at this hotel for one week. The rooms were perfect size - maybe too small for Americans but not for europeans. It was the only small hotel with charm in san juan at a reasonable price. The food was very, very good and the chef made different things we asked upon request. that was very special! the front desk girl helped us understand the bus system and we visited old san juan area several times in this way. It is worth to visit ld san juan too. Our favorit thing, and most important for us is the beach. It was the best! Not too many tourist at this side of the beach so it was very nice. The service in the hotel was outstanding! All the people were so nice -- also in general in Puerto Rico. We will come back hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beach House Hotel is Racist & Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: TrueCommunicator
Reviews.Content: This hotel will not watch out for your safety or your children. The General Manager and his next in line are not true professionals and will cheat you. This hotel purposely overbooks and selectively chooses which guests they will ask to leave based on color and preference. This hotel displays a desperate economic side of Puerto Rico. DON'T give your money up front to stay here. In fact there are so many better places. Spend the extra money and get the security and professionalism of the Marriott or another brand hotel. The customer service was poor and the hotel itself is only mediocre. Wouldn't want to see anyone else's visit to Puerto Rico ruined because of a stay at the Beach House Hotel. Life is to short, find a better hotel. ... truly dissapointed in the Puerto Rico trip, simply because of a corrupt venue with callous and poor management.

Reviews.Title: “It could be delightful BUT...”
Reviews.Author: grusso
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice - a week apart - at this hotel and had almost exactly the same experience each time which motivated me to write this review. The convenient location just ten minute drive from the airport and right on a very nice stretch of beach has let this hotel get away with the huge flaws the management doesn't seem to want to do anything about. A former 50's motel with tiny rooms, it's been tidied up and freshened with simple cosmetics. The rooms, though tiny, were clean enough, but the windows were hermetically sealed, and the very loud air conditioning competed with the non stop blaring noise from the on site disco which made sleeping a challenge, even on a Sunday night. The biggest shortcoming at the Beach House Hotel is the poor quality of service by the staff who, though pleasant, were either clueless, disorganized, or incompetent, and needed training, guidance or replacement. The following are just a few examples: We sat for nearly an hour at the outdoor restaurant trying to get someone to take our order, and when we tried to use the one-free-drink-coupons we received at check-in, were told it applied to only one wine selection and one beer selection...no special drinks like pina colada or daquiri. Our salads arrived without dressing and we still had no forks, knives or napkins. It took so long to get utensils we started to eat the salad with our fingers. There weren't very many patrons in the restaurant, but the one table that was receiving a lot of attention was where the owner and his family were eating. The owner got up to do things a number of times but never noticed we were not being attended to. Finally our utensils arrived and we ordered the saffron colored seafood paella which we saw at the owner's table and made a point of telling our waiter we wanted exactly that paella (because the week before we had ordered the seafood paella and after a very long wait had been served a mixed paella with bits of sausage and meat instead...we were so hungry we ate it anyway). We had been seated for almost two hours when we were served our seafood paella which was not like the owner's at all. No golden saffron colored rice like what he was eating... instead meager pieces of fish and seafood in a bed of overly salted, greasy rice, a disappointment which we expressed to the waiter who shrugged his shoulders and said it wasn't his fault. Again, we were hungry and ate it anyway. Only one of the desserts on the menu was available and no coffee because the coffee machine was broken. We actually wondered if we were on a candid camera show because we were being so poorly served and treated, we thought it couldn't be for real...but it was! At breakfast (which was included in the price of the room), there was coffee (different coffee maker?) but no milk for the cold cereal or coffee, and the fruit was so far past its prime it was moments away from rotten. The waiter was pleasant but said sorry we're out of milk. There's a 7eleven across the street, why would they be out of milk? At breakfast during our previous stay the week before, the strawberries, pineapple, and cantaloupe were rotting ripe, but the grapes were good, but this week there were no grapes...and no milk. This hotel/restaurant experience was unnecessarily bad and not worth the price we paid. The beach setting is very nice, but it's only worth staying at the Beach House Hotel if you don't care about eating or sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: johnnysmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 13 month-old son and myself stayed at The Beach House Hotel during the Martin Luther King holiday weekend in January. We were supposed to stay with relatives but plans changed and decided to find a hotel for our last days in PR. Everything available at that point was over $350 at the Marriot, the Condado Plaza, the El San Juan and even at the smaller hotels the prices were outrageous. After reading a few reviews of this hotel we decided to give it a try. 1. Location - Right on the beach. Perfect! 2. Rates - I called the hotel directly and was offered a room for $185 per night including taxes, fees and daily breakfast. I saw previous posts complaining about the taxes and fees. These are imposed by the government of Puerto Rico and not by this hotel in particular. Actually, every hotel in Puerto Rico charges the same percentage of taxes and resort fees, etc. We have paid similar or higher taxes and fees in other Caribbean islands like Dominican Republic and Turks & Caicos. 3. Check in - Quick and simple. The front desk girl was very friendly and attentive. 4. Noise complaints - The front desk girl and a maid voiced their concerns of having our child being bothered by the noise (there was a private party a few steps from our room on the terrace). She assured us that the party will be over early in the evening. The party was over at about 7:00 pm. Afterwards, we did hear music from the bar but not late at night. I am a very light sleeper and didn't wake up at all from any noise. We had the air conditioner running and maybe this helped the noise factor. Perhaps there is more noise on the other side near the Lounge. I think the management should address this issue because I don't think anyone want to stay in a hotel with music blasting all night. 5. Room - Clean and decent sized. We were on #12 which is on the second floor in the corner above the bar area. We had enough space for our suitcases, a playpen and a stroller. We had two double beds which were very comfortable. There was a TV with cable with lots of channels and a Ihome Clock Radio system for Ipod. We didn't have any problems with the bathroom or water pressure or water temperature. 6. Bar, Lounge and Restaurant - Right away, we had our complimentary cocktails (mojitos) which were the best we had in a long time. On our last night I stopped by the lounge and as suggested by the bartender (I think his name was Carlos) got a pitcher of mojitos to take to our room. The lounge was beautiful and would've have definitely enjoyed it in our "single" days. We had also the free breakfast. Basic but sufficient to hold us until our next meal. 7. The staff at the bar, the beach attendants, front desk attendants and maids offered excellent service at all times. This is a small hotel and it doesn't offer a lot of amenities like the big hotels but it was perfect for us. Room service, casinos, big restaurants, are not on our list of necessities so we were pretty happy with The Beach House Hotel. I also found the environment of the hotel to be family friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel for our next trip to Puerto Rico this year.
